titleInfo.title: Letter from James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, Temporarily in Charge of the Residency, Bushire, to Captain Thomas Perronet Thompson, Political Agent at Keshme [Qeshm]

mods.abstract: In this letter, James Dow, Assistant Surgeon, temporarily in charge of the Residency, acknowledges the receipt of Captain Thomas Perronet Thompson's letter of 3 December 1820, which enclosed a letter from Captain Robert Waite, the Pay Master to the force in the Gulf, requesting Dow's aid in raising 50,000 rupees at Bushire. Dow states that the sum is in his possession and is ready for transmission to Keshme [Qeshm] by the first available cruizer, which he expects will be the Honourable Company cruiser, the Aurora.
